Questions.Question: What term describes the practice of casting non-Latinx actors for Latinx roles?
Questions.Explanation: Whitewashing is the casting of white actors to portray characters of non-white ethnicities, often denying opportunities to authentic representation.

Questions.Question: Who was the first Asian actress to win an Academy Award for Best Actress?
Questions.Explanation: Youn Yuh-jung made history at the 93rd Academy Awards, becoming the first Korean actress to win an Oscar in any acting category.

Questions.Question: In which film did a transgender actress receive an Oscar nomination for Best Supporting Actress?
Questions.Explanation: The Danish Girl featured actress Alicia Vikander, who portrayed the supportive wife of a transgender woman, winning the Best Supporting Actress Oscar.

Questions.Question: Which film star became the first Black woman to win an Academy Award for Best Actress?
Questions.Explanation: Halle Berry's powerful performance in 'Monster's Ball' earned her the groundbreaking Oscar win in 2002.

Questions.Question: Who directed the first mainstream Hollywood film to feature an all-Asian cast in 25 years?
Questions.Explanation: Jon M. Chu directed 'Crazy Rich Asians,' a groundbreaking moment for representation in Hollywood, released in 2018.

Questions.Question: Which film introduced the first openly gay character in the Marvel Cinematic Universe?
Questions.Explanation: Thor: Ragnarok featured Valkyrie, portrayed by Tessa Thompson, as the first openly LGBTQ+ character in the MCU.

Questions.Question: In what year did the #OscarsSoWhite movement gain prominence on social media?
Questions.Explanation: The #OscarsSoWhite hashtag trended in 2016, igniting a larger conversation about diversity and representation in the film industry.

Questions.Question: Who was the first Muslim actor to win an Academy Award for Best Actor?
Questions.Explanation: Mahershala Ali made history with his Oscar win for 'Moonlight,' becoming the first Muslim actor to win the Best Supporting Actor award.

Questions.Question: Which film marked the first time an Indigenous woman was nominated for Best Director at the Academy Awards?
Questions.Explanation: Nomadland, directed by Chloé Zhao, allowed her to make history as the first woman of color and second woman ever to win the Best Director Oscar.

Questions.Question: In what film did a non-binary actor receive an Academy Award nomination?
Questions.Explanation: Glenn Close portrayed a woman living as a man in 'Albert Nobbs,' representing a historic moment for non-binary visibility in film.

Questions.Question: Which movie featured the first disabled actress to win an Academy Award for Best Actress?
Questions.Explanation: Marlee Matlin's portrayal of a deaf woman in 'Children of a Lesser God' made her the first deaf performer to win an Oscar.

Questions.Question: Who was the first woman of color to win an Academy Award for Best Director?
Questions.Explanation: Kathryn Bigelow's win for directing 'The Hurt Locker' made her the first and only woman to win the Best Director Oscar to date.

Questions.Question: In which film did a non-binary character appear in the lead role?
Questions.Explanation: Elle Fanning portrayed a transgender teen in '3 Generations,' bringing visibility to non-binary characters in mainstream films.

Questions.Question: Which actor became the first openly gay person to win an Academy Award for Best Actor?
Questions.Explanation: Sir Ian McKellen's iconic performance in 'Gods and Monsters' earned him the honor of being the first openly gay man to win the Best Actor Oscar.

Questions.Question: Which film featured the first Latina to win an Academy Award for Best Actress?
Questions.TrueAnswer: How to Get Away with Murder
Questions.Explanation: In 'How to Get Away with Murder,' Viola Davis portrayed the powerful role of Annalise Keating, making history with her outstanding performance.

Questions.Question: Who was the first Asian woman to win an Academy Award for Best Director?
Questions.Explanation: Chloé Zhao broke barriers with her win for directing 'Nomadland,' becoming the first Asian woman and only the second woman ever to win the Best Director Oscar.

Questions.Question: In which film did a Black actress win an Oscar for portraying a transgender woman?
Questions.Explanation: Dallas Buyers Club earned actress Jared Leto an Oscar for his portrayal of a transgender woman, Rayon, in a supporting role.

Questions.Question: Which film prominently featured HIV/AIDS activism and the LGBTQ+ community in the 1990s?
Questions.Explanation: Philadelphia, starring Tom Hanks and Denzel Washington, shed light on the impact of the AIDS crisis and discrimination faced by the LGBTQ+ community.

Questions.Question: Who became the first openly transgender person to be nominated for an Academy Award?
Questions.Explanation: Yance Ford's documentary 'Strong Island' led to a historic moment, earning the first Oscar nomination for an openly transgender director.

Questions.Question: Which movie was the first to portray an authentic and positive representation of autism?
Questions.Explanation: 'Rain Man' starring Dustin Hoffman and Tom Cruise, authentically depicted an individual with autism, raising awareness and understanding.
